channel.title: Adding Runescape to a website?
channel.description:
Hey guys, a few of you might know me from Kaitneiks's forums around a year and a half ago. Congrats on the popularity of the site, Moparisthebest. I had been wondering where all the Kaitnieks'ers had gone. ;) Also good work on your private server client. I played around with it and some different private server sources and it all works very well. I never imagined that something like this would come around. Pretty neat. I've recently become interested in Runescape again and I'm having a problem. I want to add the Runescape client to my own personal webpage. I took the source of http://sl3.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=0&plugin=1 and saved it onto my desktop. Doesn't work. Opened the source of the page. Here's an excerpt:
I'm guessing that I need to add something before the "plugin.js?lowmem=0&plugin=1" and a few other places. I've tried a few things and can't get it to work. Always shows a box with an X. If you know of a tutorial or can give me some advice just let me know. Thanks.

item.title: Adding Runescape to a website?
item.dc:creator: @xxnoxx xxnoxx
item.description:
@xxnoxx wrote:

if u put this on your website it will work

runescape

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Runescape to a website?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

do you mean for regular runescape or for private servers?

for regular runescape take the source of www.moparisthebest.com/rs2.php

not sure if thats what you wanted to do or not, just try it and let me know

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Runescape to a website?
item.dc:creator: @disinterested disinterested
item.description:
@disinterested wrote:

Hey guys, a few of you might know me from Kaitneiks’s forums around a year and a half ago. Congrats on the popularity of the site, Moparisthebest. I had been wondering where all the Kaitnieks’ers had gone.

Also good work on your private server client. I played around with it and some different private server sources and it all works very well. I never imagined that something like this would come around. Pretty neat.

I’ve recently become interested in Runescape again and I’m having a problem. I want to add the Runescape client to my own personal webpage.

I took the source of http://sl3.runescape.com/lang/en/aff/runescape/game.ws?lowmem=0&plugin=1 and saved it onto my desktop. Doesn’t work. Opened the source of the page. Here’s an excerpt:

I’m guessing that I need to add something before the “plugin.js?lowmem=0&plugin=1” and a few other places. I’ve tried a few things and can’t get it to work. Always shows a box with an X.

If you know of a tutorial or can give me some advice just let me know. Thanks.

Read full topic
